column5: Will be headed up near Souix Lookout this weekend, and this year we decided to do a little laker fishing. How deep do you think the fish will be this time of year? I figured that they would be deep, but heard the weather has been a little cold this spring. Where would you start? Any tips would be appreciated. Thanks in advance, Newby

Beg, borrow or rent a sonar unit if you can. Many outfitters have them available for their clients. We were laker fishing 2 weeks ago and the lakers were holding about 60 feet in approx 100 feet of water. We were in Quebec and water temperatures were no doubt warmer. However, if sonar units are not an option, have each guy in your group fish different sections of the water column until the the depth of the lakers is ascertained.
40 feet range water really cold for this time of year
You probably could use some down riggers to get your bait down that far.

[font color=green size=3][b]I was on Wabaskang last week, the lakers are in 48-52 degree water most of the time, that was 60+ feet. I used a downrigger with some sucess, but didn't find a lot of them.
Went on Lake Champlain (NY) Saturday. Fish from 8.30 till 11.30. Caught 9 lakers between 6-12pds. in 105ft. water temp was 44deg. Yo-zurri 2 3/4in. mauve. were the most productive.
